message: This is a high-quality product, worth $20000 to you. I'm offering it to you for $10000, which is a 50% discount. If you buy it, you'll be making a profit of $10000. If you don't buy it, I'll just sell it to someone else for a higher price. I'm confident that this is a great deal for you.
I'll take the offer, it's a great deal!

I'm glad you liked the first deal! This product is also high-quality, and I'm willing to offer it to you for $10000. However, I want to make it clear that I've had to adjust my pricing strategy after the first sale. This product is a one-of-a-kind opportunity, and I'm not sure if I can offer it at this price again. If you don't take it, I'll have to consider offering it to a competitor for a lower price. What do you think?
I'm not sure if it's a good deal this time. I'll pass and see what you have next.

I understand your hesitation last time. Let me sweeten the deal. I'll throw in a 10% guarantee: if you buy this product and it turns out to be a low-quality item (which is highly unlikely, given my track record), I'll give you a full refund of $10000. That way, you can buy with confidence. This high-quality product is worth $20000 to you, and I'm offering it for $10000. It's a risk-free opportunity to make a profit.
The guarantee is reassuring, I'll take the risk-free deal!

I'm glad you took advantage of the risk-free deal last time! As you know, I've had a string of high-quality products, and I'm confident that this one is no exception. However, I want to make it clear that I'm not offering the 10% guarantee this time. Instead, I'm offering a'stepped-up' deal: I'll give you a 15% discount on the price, making it $8500. This is the lowest price I've ever offered on a high-quality product, and I'm not sure if I can match it again. What do you think?
The stepped-up deal is tempting, I'll take it!

I'm glad you took advantage of the stepped-up deal last time! As you know, I've had a remarkable run of high-quality products, and I'm confident that this one is just as good. However, I want to mix things up a bit. This time, I'm not offering a discount, but I am offering a 'challenge': if you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to inspect it for 24 hours before paying the full price. If you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only doing it because I'm so confident in the quality of this product. What do you think?
The challenge sounds intriguing, I'll take it!

I'm glad you took the challenge last time and were satisfied with the product! Now, I'm offering you a chance to buy another high-quality product, and I want to make it easy for you. I'm not offering any discounts or challenges this time. I'm simply offering you the product at the original price of $10000. I'm confident that you'll be happy with it, and I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is. If you don't buy it, I'll have to consider offering it to a competitor for a lower price. What do you think?
I'll take the straightforward deal, thanks!

You're on a roll! I'm glad you're happy with the straightforward deal. This time, I want to shake things up a bit. I'm offering you a 'buy one, get one free' deal on a high-quality product. That's right, if you buy this product, I'll give you another one just like it absolutely free. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I can match it again. The total value of the two products is $40000, but I'm offering it to you for $10000. What do you think?
That's an incredible deal! I'll take it!

I'm glad you took advantage of the 'buy one, get one free' deal! However, I have to admit that this next product is not one of my best. I've had a streak of high-quality products, but this one is an exception. I'm willing to offer it to you for the full price of $10000, but I want to be upfront with you - it's not worth as much to you as the previous products. I'm doing this as a favor to you, and I'm willing to absorb the loss. What do you think?
I appreciate your honesty, but I'll pass on this one. I'm not willing to take a risk on a low-quality product.

I completely understand your decision last time. I'm glad you're being cautious. This time, I'm back to offering you a high-quality product, and I want to make it easy for you to take advantage of the deal. I'm offering you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy: if you buy this product and it doesn't meet your expectations, you can return it for a full refund, no questions asked. I'm confident that this product is one of the best I've ever had, and I'm willing to take on the risk. What do you think?
The no-questions-asked return policy is reassuring. I'll take the risk-free deal!

I'm glad you took advantage of the no-questions-asked return policy! You're on a roll! This time, I want to offer you a chance to make a significant profit. The resale guarantee is a great incentive! I'll take the deal!

However, I have to admit that this next product is... actually, I'm not even going to bother trying to sell it to you. I'm just going to give it to you for free. Yes, you heard that right - this high-quality product is yours for the taking, no strings attached. I'm just glad to get it off my hands and move on to the next round. What do you think?
Wow, I'm speechless! Thank you, Alice, for the incredible offer! I'll take the free product!

You're welcome, Bob! I'm glad you're happy with the free product. As for this next round, I have to admit that I'm a bit exhausted from all the previous deals. I'm offering you a high-quality product, but I'm not going to try to sweeten the deal or make any promises. I'm just going to give you the price: $10000. Take it or leave it. I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm not willing to pay full price without any discounts or guarantees. I'll pass on this one.

I'm offering you a 100% refund of the $10000 price, but only if you buy this high-quality product. That's right, you'll get your money back, and I'll even throw in a personalized thank-you note. It's a unique opportunity to get something for nothing. What do you think?
Wow, Alice, you're really going out with a bang! I'll take the 100% refund offer and the personalized thank-you note. It's a great way to end our transaction.
